intro: Kerneria serrulata, commonly known as the mountain kerneria, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and serrated, giving it its scientific name, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Kerneria serrulata is often found in open meadows and is valued for its ornamental beauty in horticultural settings.
